Quick search

Enter search terms or a module, class or function name.

marray Module¶

Storing measurements and calculated results. This is done through arrays with metadata (Marray and subclasses). It also includes Schema which specifies how results should be computed in an analogous interface to how Marrays are specified.

class holopy.core.marray.Image(arr, spacing=None, optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), metadata={}, dtype=None, **kwargs)¶

2D rectangular grid of measurements or calculations.

Parameters :

arr : array

raw array data/calculations (without metadata)

spacing : array(dtype=float)

spacing between values along each axis in the Image

optics : Optics object

Information about the optical train associated with this schema

origin : (float, float, float)

Offset for the origin of the space represented by this Schema.

dtype : data-type, optional

The desired data-type for the array. If not given, then the type will be determined as the minimum type required to hold the objects in the sequence. This argument can only be used to ‘upcast’ the array. For downcasting, use the .astype(t) method.
class holopy.core.marray.ImageSchema(shape=None, spacing=None, optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), metadata={}, **kwargs)¶

Description of a desired Image.

An ImageSchema contains all of the information needed to calculate an Image

Parameters :

shape : tuple(int)

shape of the desired Marray object. Should be a tuple of 1 or more integers for the shape along each axis.

spacing : array(dtype=float)

spacing between values along each axis in the ImageSchema

optics : Optics object

Information about the optical train associated with this schema

origin : (float, float, float)

Offset for the origin of the space represented by this Schema.
class holopy.core.marray.Marray(arr, positions=None, optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), dtype=None, **kwargs)¶

Generic Array with metadata

You usually should use a more appropriate subclass, raw Marrays are somewhat cumbersome to use.

Parameters :

arr : array

raw array data/calculations (without metadata)

positions : PositionSpecification object

Specification of the locations of measurements

optics : Optics object

Information about the optical train associated with this schema

origin : (float, float, float)

Offset for the origin of the space represented by this Schema.

dtype : data-type, optional

The desired data-type for the array. If not given, then the type will be determined as the minimum type required to hold the objects in the sequence. This argument can only be used to ‘upcast’ the array. For downcasting, use the .astype(t) method.
class holopy.core.marray.Schema(shape=None, positions=None, optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), metadata={}, **kwargs)¶

Most general description of a desired array with metadata

A Schema contains metadata for an array and a description of what data the array should hold. Schema themselves do not contain array data.

Parameters :

shape : tuple(int)

shape of the desired Marray object. Should be a tuple of 1 or more integers for the shape along each axis.

positions : PositionSpecification object

Specification of the locations of measurements

optics : Optics object

Information about the optical train associated with this schema

origin : (float, float, float)

Offset for the origin of the space represented by this Schema.
get_metadata_from(schema, prefer_self=True)¶

Fill in the metadata for this schema from another

Parameters :

schema : Schema

Other schema from which to get metadata for this one

prefer_mine : Bool

If true, use values in self any case they exist and only get values from schema where they are absent. If true, overwrite self’s values with those from schema
Returns :

Nothing : updates in place
class holopy.core.marray.VectorGrid(arr, spacing=None, components=('x', 'y', 'z'), optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), dtype=None, **kwargs)¶

Vector Data on a Rectangular Grid

{attrs}

class holopy.core.marray.Volume(arr, spacing=None, optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), metadata={}, dtype=None, **kwargs)¶

3D rectangular grid of measurements or calculations.

{attrs}

class holopy.core.marray.VolumeSchema(shape=None, spacing=None, optics=None, origin=array([ 0., 0., 0.]), **kwargs)¶

Description of a desired Volume.

An VolumeSchema contains all of the information needed to calculate a Volume

Parameters :

shape : tuple(int)

shape of the desired Marray object. Should be a tuple of 1 or more integers for the shape along each axis.

spacing : array(dtype=float)

spacing between values along each axis in the VolumeSchema

optics : Optics object

Information about the optical train associated with this schema

origin : (float, float, float)

Offset for the origin of the space represented by this Schema.
holopy.core.marray.arr_like(arr, template=None, **override)¶

Make a new Marray with metadata like an old one

Parameters :

arr : numpy.ndarray

Array data to add metadata to

template : Schema (optional)

Marray to copy metadata from. If not given, will be copied from arr (probably used in this case for overrides)

**override : kwargs

Optional additional keyword args. They will be used to override specific metadata
Returns :

res : Marray

Marray like template containing data from arr
holopy.core.marray.resize(arr, center=None, extent=None, spacing=None)¶

Resize and resample an marray

Parameters :

arr : Marray

Marray to resize

center : array(float) optional

Desired center of the new marray. Default is the old center

extent : array(float) optional

Desired extent of the new marray. Default is the old extent

spacing : array(float) optional

Desired spacing of the new marray. Default is the old spacing
Returns :

arr : Marray

Desired cut of arr. Will be a view into the old array unless spacing is changed
holopy.core.marray.squeeze(arr)¶

Turns an NxMx1 array into an NxM array.

holopy.core.marray.subimage(arr, center, shape)¶

Pick out a region of an image or other array

Parameters :

arr : numpy.ndarray

The array to subimage

center : tuple of ints

The desired center of the region, should have the same number of elements as the arr has dimensions

shape : int or tuple of ints

Desired shape of the region. If a single int is given the region will be that dimension in along every axis. Shape should be even
Returns :

sub : numpy.ndarray or RegularGrid marray object

Subset of shape shape centered at center. For marrays, marray.origin will be set such that the upper left corner of the output has coordinates relative to the input.
holopy.core.marray.zeros_like(obj, dtype=None)¶

Make an empty marray with the same shape and metadata as the template.

Parameters :

obj : Schema

Template object (schema or marray)

dtype : numpy.dtype

Optional argument to override array type
Returns :

arr : Marray

Empty (all zeros) marray with shape and metadata copied from obj
